intro: Perezia wislizeni, commonly known as the desert perezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, adding a splash of color to its native habitat. Perezia wislizeni is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
